issue.description: Issues can only be raised against modules.

comment.description: Can now raise issues against AP docs and resources.

issue.description: module.xsl assumes that all modules are owned by WG12 - some will be owned by WG3. Need to provide an optional attribute that will indicate that the module is owned by WG3

comment.description: Added

description.p: The Foreword is missing the footnote text after reference to ISO 10303-1 "- A future edition of ISO 10303-1 will describe the application modules series."
Raised this with convener as will affect TS PDM modules

comment.description: Greg OK - but would like it only applied to PLCS modules. Added to module.xsl
Footnote added.

description.p: Proposed new wording for Annex A - Short names
Where there are NO short names the annex A will read:

Entity names in this part of ISO 10303 have been defined in other parts of ISO 10303 ISO standards identified in clause 2. Requirements on the use of the short names are found in the implementation methods included in ISO 10303.
If there are short names,

Table A.1 provides the short names for entities defined in the MIM of this part of ISO 10303.
Entity names in this part of ISO 10303 have been defined in clause 5.2 and in other parts of ISO 10303 ISO standards identified in clause 2.
Requirements on the use of the short names are found in the implementation methods included in ISO 10303.
Raised this with convener as will affect TS PDM modules

comment.description: Greg OK with the change Added to module.xsl
Changes made

description.p: 9. The "Comments to Reader" box contains the required text and other text appropriate for the audience of the part during this ballot cycle. (See 4.1.1.3 of the SD, http://www.nist.gov/sc4/editing/cover/cov_read.htm.)

Comments: According to SD N1217 4.1.1.2 cover page should include "Recipients of this draft are invited to submit, with their comments, notification of any relevant patent rights of which they are aware and to provide supporting documentation." Potentially in the comments to reader box.
Raised this with convener as will affect TS PDM modules

comment.description: Added to module.xsl

issue.description: There is no provision for Annex H Technical discussions

The <rule> element in a mapping specification, can either be a rule OR a subtype constraint. This is confusing. Furthermore, the description of the rules field at the top of section 5.1 does not mention subtype constraints at all.
We should have a rule and subtype element in mapping specification, or describe the fact that the a rule may be a rule or sub type constraint.

comment.description: There already exits a <constraint> element in the mapping specification. The XSL has been modified to describe the constraints.

description.p: 2 Normative references
"Use em dash, not hyphen, after ""10303-11:."""

comment.description: Corrected
Asked convener for waiver

description.p: Introduction

"""Double quotation marks "" "" denote quoted text. Single quotation marks ' ' denote particular text string values."" The meaning of this sentence is unclear. Of course text in quotes is quoted text."

comment.description: This is boilerplate for all the modules. Not sure how it should be changed?

description.p: 5.1 Mapping specification

"In the mappings of assertions, the first entity name is a hyperlink, but the second is not. For example, in:
5.1.1.1 Classification_assignment to Product_group (as items)
Classification_assignment is a hyperlink but Product_group is not."

comment.description: Modified XSL accordingly

description.p: A MIM short names
The caption for Table A.1 uses a hyphen instead of an em dash to separate the table number from the table title.

comment.description: Modified XSL accordingly

description.p: Bibliography
"Use an em dash rather than a hyphen between ""document"" and ""Guidelines."""

comment.description: Asked convener for waiver
Corrected.

description.p: "C ARM EXPRESS-G and D MIM EXPRESS-G"
Links to figures should not be in a bulleted list.

comment.description: So how should they be listed?

Each link should be in a

element

issue.description: 1. The Contents page does not list the preliminary pages (Foreword and Introduction), although the Contents banner that appears at the top of each page does.

comment.description: The Supplimentary Directives: ISO TC184/SC4 N1217:2001(E) state: 4.1.3 Table of contents a list of clauses, higher level subclauses, annexes, the bibliography (if present), and the index; As the Foreword and Introduction are not clauses they are not included in the Contents page. I believe that the same is true of ALL SC4 parts. Links are included in the Contents banner to enable the user to navigate to them.

description.p: Question to ISO: Is it the wish of ISO CS that we include these additional elements in the Contents page? If so, SC4 will have to modify our scripts.
Answer from ISO: No. We are happy to leave it as is for this series of documents.

issue.description: 2. The first half of the Foreword seems to be correct, but the second half has some variations from the standard text: The paragraph concerning PAS/TS review is incomplete; the link to the 10303 part titles is incorrect; and annex information is included at the end of the Foreword.

comment.description: The link to the Part titles seems to be broken...and the forewords should no longer contain a statement specifying which annexes are normative and which are informative. Where did we get the text for the Foreword?
the link http://www.tc184-sc4.org/titles/STEP_Titles.rtf does not work. It should. The text is as specified in the Sup. Directives: ISO TC184/SC4 N1217:2001(E). What should it be?
It should be http://www.tc184-sc4.org/titles/STEP_Titles.htm.
Changed the link http://www.tc184-sc4.org/titles/STEP_Titles.rtf to http://www.tc184-sc4.org/titles/STEP_Titles.htm. in AP, Resources and modules.

description.p: New Foreword for provided by ISO as an example.

comment.description: Changed AP and module foreword to that specified by ISO

issue.description: 3. All of the Normative references are dated. Please verify if this is necessary, according to 6.2.2 and 6.6.7.5 of the ISO/IEC Directives, Part 2.

comment.description: In view of the need to maintain configuration control across a modular structure, SC4 will always need to refer to specific dated issues of modules.

There are other ways to accomplish the same thing. By having dated normative references to modules, we will force ISO to retain all versions of all modules in the ISO catalog for the forseeable future. That could be a big administrative burden. We are basically using ISO's publication system with its numbering scheme for a purpose it was never intended -- as a de facto PDM system for SC4.
Although the current approach may be necessary in the short term, I believe that SC4 should consider alternative approaches that would allow undated normative references for the longer term.

description.p: SC4 Response: In view of the need to maintain configuration control across a modular structure, SC4 will need to refer to specific dated issues of modules. This requirement will be reviewed as modules become increasingly stable.
ISO response: Thank you for the explanation. No action required.

issue.description: 4. Clause 3 "Terms and abbreviations", should be titled "Terms, definitions and abbreviations" or, when there are no abbreviations, "Terms and definitions".

comment.description: This appears to be in line with the Directives Part 2, and needs to be corrected.

And have seen the following in 4.2.5 in the supplementary directives:
- If clause 3 only contains terms and definitions, the title of the clause shall be "Terms and definitions". - If clause 3 only contains terms, definitions, and abbreviations, the title of the clause shall be "Terms, definitions, and abbreviations". - If clause 3 only contains terms, definitions, and symbols, the title of the clause shall be "Terms, definitions, and symbols". - If clause 3 contains terms, definitions, abbreviations, and symbols, the title of the clause shall be "Terms, definitions, abbreviations, and symbols".
A number of the modules just contain Terms and Abbreviations. Hence, the XSL outputs Terms and Abbreviations - I can change it to output Terms, definitions, and abbreviations But there are no definitions.
So, in this case, what should the title be

description.p:
SC4 Response: Our Supplementary Directives include the following guidance (4.2.5) - If clause 3 only contains terms and definitions, the title of the clause shall be "Terms and definitions". - If clause 3 only contains terms, definitions, and abbreviations, the title of the clause shall be "Terms, definitions, and abbreviations". - If clause 3 only contains terms, definitions, and symbols, the title of the clause shall be "Terms, definitions, and symbols". - If clause 3 contains terms, definitions, abbreviations, and symbols, the title of the clause shall be "Terms, definitions, abbreviations, and symbols".
A number of the modules just contain terms and abbreviations. Hence, the XSL outputs "Terms and abbreviations." Please confirm that you in fact want the title of the clause to contain "definitions" even if there are no definitions. If this is so, then we will change the script accordingly.
ISO response: Yes, please make the requested change because, even though there are no definitions on these pages, the user is pointed to terms and definitions elsewhere.

comment.description: I have made the changes. every module references Terms defined in other standards, and abbreviations. Some may include definitions. Hence the clause 3 is always called "3 Terms, definitions and definitions" as per ISO request above.

issue.description: 5. All of the headings seem to be H2 style. Is it possible to use different heading styles for different levels of headings (e.g. 1, 1.1, 1.1.1, etc.)?

comment.description: I believe this proposal is an editorial opinion, which is counter to the content of the Directives, and their example, where all headings appear in the same font.

The HTML Guidelines say: "All clause and subclause headings, regardless of level, shall be enclosed within H2 elements, except that the clauses defining terms shall be enclosed within H4 elements." AP 239 does seem to be following this.
This was done to maintain compatibility with existing traditional APs, which use the same font size for various heading levels.
Note that the ISO STD Template uses 12 point for level 1 headings, 11 point for level 2 headings, and 10 point for level 3 and higher headings, but the Supplementary Directives mandates 14 point for level 1, 12 point for level 2 and 11 point for level 3 and higher.
We were hampered by the fact that we were told that ISO did not allow the use of cascading style sheets. With cascading style sheets, it would be possible use different heading tags for different heading levels, while still having them display in the same font size (if that is desired).

description.p: SC4 Response: All our current standards (and the ISO Directives) use the same font size for different levels of headings, and this has been carried forward into the HTML guidelines. To replicate this with different heading tags would require the use of cascading style sheets, which ISO told us were not permitted. Also, to rework all the headings to use different tags and/or use cascading style sheets would require a substantial amount of effort. Please confirm whether it is considered essential to deviate from previously accepted practice.
ISO response: No, you may leave the heading styles as they are. No action required.

issue.description: 6. The figure captions all seem to have the words "1 of 1" at the end. Is there a reason for this?

comment.description: The figures being referred to are EXPRESS-G figures which are a sequence of EXPRESS-G diagrams that can span more than one page, hence there is the convention to say "1 of n" where n is the total number of pages in the diagram. In the examples looked at there was only 1 page to the diagrams, hence "1 of 1". There are many other examples where there is more than 1 page to an EXPRESS-G diagram.

ISO response: Please feel free to leave these as they are for these documents. No action required. However, it would be useful for the future if you could explain when we meet next week the reasoning of the "1 of 1" on HTML pages.

issue.description: 7. The Bibliography layout is incorrect. Please see ISO 690 for the correct layout.

comment.description: Not sure what is incorrect. I though that the rules specified in the supplementary directives had been followed.

The HTML Guidelines do not have any specific guidance on the formatting of the Bibliography.
Please be more specific about what is the problem. I thought that SD section 4.3.2.1 was based on ISO 690. The "layout" seems to be the same as in the SD, except that there is a "hanging indent" (second and following lines of each bibliography entry are indented) shown in the example in the SD that is not present in the documents provided. Is this what Mr. Cook is referring to? Or has ISO 690 been updated and the update not reflected in the SD?
It would be helpful if a copy of ISO 690 could be placed in the SC4 Standards Developers Information/ISO Standards folder on SC4ONLINE for use by people preparing SC4 parts.
ISO response: The Bibliography is acceptable for these documents. No action required.

issue.description: 8. The links between documents and many links within documents are broken.

comment.description: The links work across multiple documents extracted into the same file strucutre, which is how they are intended to be used. This has been agreed with the ISO TPM, since the principal publication will be integrated on a CD-ROM.

description.p: SC4 response: Can you provide some examples of the internal links that you consider to be broken, assuming that the files have been unzipped inclusive of the directory structure?
ISO response: One example is in the first paragraph of 4.3.1 of ISO/TS 10303-1004. SC4 needs to check this.
The link does not work as it is a link to a separate module.

issue.description: 9. There is a file called "f_guide.htm" with each of the documents. It appears to be a template for another annex, but has not been completed in any of the documents we evaluated. Is it necessary to leave it, or should it be removed if it is not being used? (Or should it be kept to possibly be used at a later date?)

comment.description: The way the XML/XSL works is that there is one html file for each possible clause / annex. If the annex has not been used in the document, as is the case here, then the HTML exists, but is not accessible from the table of contents. It would be easier if we could leave the file there. We could add some text that said "An Application module implementation and usage guide has not been provided" so if a user did open the file directly they know that the annex was not provided.

It is trivial to add the text: "An Application module implementation and usage guide has not been provided" so I have. Modifiying the readme will more work. There is an assumption that people will open each file individually. I had always assumed that as it was an HTML document, users would navigate their way around the document using the HTML links provided in the document and never look at the individual HTML files

issue.description: Remove the copyright statement from the Table of contents page as this appears on the cover page.

comment.description: removed from AP, Modules and resource documents.

Advised by email from Richard Cook ISO From: Cook [mailto:cook@iso.org] Sent: 04 November 2004 16:11 Subject: RE: AP239 modules
The ISO copyright footer does not appear on the Contents page.
This has now been added

issue.description: Modify the cover page to be as provided by ISO.

description.p: Are we expecting ISO to edit these cover pages? If so, what happens when we publish an AP? The AP will include its modules, which will have been previously published, and may have been included in other APs. Are ISO going to go through all the modules that go with the AP and correct the ISO coverpage? It would be better if we could provide them with a front page generated from the modules XMLs.
The issues are:
The French title Everything is French, except for the name of the module.

The edition statement: ???? edition ####-##-## I assume that the ???? equals First second etc. What Does ####-##-## mean? Is that the date of publication? I presume that this is set by ISO. If so, then we have an issue when we package modules Or, is it the date we decide to send it to ISO? Right now we only record the year of publication in the module. I have output First edition 2004
They include Price base on ## pages What does this mean? Am I supposed to write some software that counts how many HTML pages there are in each module? Not something that I really have time to do ...
They include: ICS ##.###.##; ##.###.## What is supposed to go here? I have included ICS 25.040.40 As that is what was discussed before

issue.description: The example provided by ISO (GOODWIN [goodwin@iso.org] Wed 19/05/2004 13:10) show that the part number in the middle of the page should be of the form: ISO/DIS #####-## ISO/TS #####-##:####(E)

comment.description: I have assumed the DIS part number should be the same form as TS So output ISO/DIS #####-##:####(E) ISO/DIS 10303-239:2004(E) ISO/TS #####-##:####(E)

issue.description: ISO (GOODWIN [goodwin@iso.org] Wed 19/05/2004 3:10) have provided a new DIS example. It shows shows the ICS number, but no part edition. E.g: ISO/DIS #####-## ICS ##.###.##; ##.###.##

comment.description: Updated to use the same HTML for copyright etc.

description.p: (2) Clause: Clause 5.1
Boiler plate for Clause 5.1 mentions UoF, which is an out-of-date concept.

comment.description: The boilerplate (xsl) should be changed for all the modules.

description.p: Changed the text to "This clause contains the mapping specification that defines how each application element of this part of ISO 10303 (see Clause 4) maps to one or more MIM elements (see Clause 5.2)."
Change made and issues copied to stepmod/doc/issues/apdoc_issues.xml
Price base on ## pages

comment.description: What does this mean? Am I supposed to write some software that counts how many HTML pages there are in each module? Not something that I really have time to do ...
The cover includes Price base(d) on ## pages How do you want to assess the page count? Given the number, we can generate automatically.

The text should be "Price based on ## pages", i.e. without the () around the d. As far as I am aware, we do not have a response from the Sales dept re the price. Unless Sophie informs you otherwise (she may have received a mail that I didn't and she's not there for me to ask today although I know she's logging in) please just generate the page count automatically and then we can adjust as necessary.
Changed to "Price based on ## pages". I do not have time to generate the page count.

issue.description: The French title Everything is French, except for the name of the module.

description.p: AFNOR are providing French titles. This means that an attribute "name.french" should be added to all modules, APs and resources and DTDs.
Who has responsibility for getting th title from AFNOR? When does that happen? Who updates all the existing modules? The DTD needs to be updated.

issue.description: The cover includes: ICS ##.###.##; ##.###.## We have included ICS 25.040.40 as that is what was discussed before - please confirm

comment.description: Sophie confirmed that this is correct.

issue.description: The cover page requires the publication date. This is provided by ISO. For the current batch of modules, it should be: 2004-12-01 This will require a change to the modules/resources/AP + DTDs. Who provides the publication date? How does that get added to the module? We need to add a publication.date attribute to every module/resource/AP + DTDs For current modules ISO say use: 2004-12-01
1. In the header "TECHNICAL SPECIFICATION ISO/TS 10303-1250" you need to add ":2004(E)" -- see our model attached for an International Standard.

comment.description: Corrected (stepmod/xsl/publication/pub_isocover.xsl)

issue.description: 2. The introductory and main elements of the title should run on, i.e. no line break between them necessary.

comment.description: Corrected (stepmod/xsl/publication/pub_isocover.xsl)

issue.description: 3. The trailing em rule at the end of the main element of the title is not necessary (because there is a line break).

comment.description: Corrected (stepmod/xsl/publication/pub_isocover.xsl)

issue.description: 4. The title given in the example you attached is not the same as that in our database: "Product data representation and exchange -- Application module -- Part 1250: Attachment slot"
5. It is ugly to include a colon in the part title as shown in the example you attached since you then have two consecutive colons: "Part #. Xxxxxxxxxx: Xxxxx"

comment.description:
Re. point 5 and double colon: If that's the way that you've done it in the past then I can't really argue but its not usual English usage and frankly is odd. I would have thought something like Industrial automation systems and integration Product data representation and exchange Part 1250: Application module "Attachment slot"
or
"Attachment slot" application module or
Industrial automation systems and integration Product data representation and exchange application modules Part 1250: Attachment slot was more usual English. Maybe bear it in mind for the next generation?
Issue closed based on comment from ISO above.

issue.description: 6. The French title contains errors -- for example the main element starts "et ..."

comment.description: AFNOR will provide the French title

issue.description: 7. The letter "d" is missing in the text "Price base on ## pages"

comment.description: Corrected (stepmod/xsl/publication/pub_isocover.xsl)

issue.description: 8. In the link to the document "ISO 10303-1250" the text should be the full reference No., i.e. in this example "ISO/TS 10303-1250:2004(E)"

comment.description: Corrected (stepmod/xsl/publication/pub_isocover.xsl)

issue.description: 9. There are two spaces beween "First" and "edition" -- there should only be one. In place of "2004" please put the full publication date "2004-12-01".

comment.description: Space issue addressed. See RBN-14 for debate on publication date.

issue.description: their DIS example has ISO/DIS #####-## ICS ##.###.##; ##.###.## It does not have the edition. I assume that the edition is required, so I have changed it to: ISO/DIS 10303-239:2004(E) First edition 2004 ICS ##.###.##; ##.###.##

comment.description:
No we don't put the edition on the DIS. What we do do, if the DIS is a revision of another standard, is to put under the title [Revision of Xxxxx edition (ISO ####:####)]
See the attached DIS for an example. This is of course not in HTML but is sufficient to give you the general idea. Off hand I don't recall a case of an HTML DIS which is a revision but if you are desperate I can always dig so let me know.
Corrected (stepmod/xsl/publication/pub_isocover.xsl)

issue.description: The TS example the DIS example that they sent uses different ISO logos. Is that correct?

comment.description: Please use the one with the horizontal lines for all DIS, TS and IS in this ISO 10303 series.

issue.description: ISO have mandated that modules are published as individual parts. Consequently, all images displayed in a module must be stored in the modules directory. is illegal for example. There should be a test that warns people that when this occurs

comment.description: Added test to common.xsl xsl:template match="img"

issue.description: The table of contents is missing the level 2 entries for Annexes B.
The abbreviations should be listed in alphabetical order

Advised by email from Richard Cook ISO From: Cook [mailto:cook@iso.org] Sent: 04 November 2004 16:11 Subject: RE: AP239 modules 3. In the document title on the Scope page, "Part x:" appears to be bold, although it is correctly not bold on the cover page.

comment.description: This is because the Title in the scope is tagged in HTML as <h1> as per the SC4 HTML guidelines - hence everything is on bold. It is not possible to make something in <h1> not bold.

issue.description:
Advised by email from Richard Cook ISO From: Cook [mailto:cook@iso.org] Sent: 04 November 2004 16:11 Subject: RE: AP239 modules
1. As we mentioned previously, the link in the Foreword - http://www.tc184-sc4.org/titles/STEP_Titles.htm - is different from the link that was agreed with SC4 last year for 10303 parts - http://www.tc184-sc4.org/titles/. Will the former be valid for the foreseeable future?

Advised by email from Richard Cook ISO From: Cook [mailto:cook@iso.org] Sent: 04 November 2004 16:11 Subject: RE: AP239 modules
5. The Terms, definitions and abbreviations clause does not use the standard ISO text: "For the purposes of this part of ISO 10303, ..." is used instead of "For the purposes of this document, ...".

comment.description: Corrected

Advised by email from Mike Gibson ISO From: Gibson [gibson@iso.org] Sent: Tue 09/11/2004 11:03 Subject: RE: AP239 modules 4. We notice that you have changed the introductory text in the Terms and definitions as requested (from "For the purposes of this part of ISO 10303..." to "For the purposes of this document...") , but only from 3.5 onward. Could you make the same change for all subclauses?

issue.description: Because of limitations of the tools, in order for the diagram links to work properly, whenever an interfaced entity is referenced , it is necessary to explicitly USE FROM the schema where the interfaced entity is originally defined, regardless of any indirect interfacing that may exist. Not sure that this is correct interpretation of issue? this issue was raised as ES1 against GDT ballot CD-TS ballot.

Advised by email from Richard Cook ISO From: Cook [mailto:cook@iso.org] Sent: 04 November 2004 16:11 Subject: RE: AP239 modules 6. As we mentioned previously, the document reference within the abstract should read "ISO/TS 10303-xxxx:2004".

comment.description: Which part of the abstract are you referring to? (I have attached on for reference) Is it <TITLE>ISO/TS 10303-1241:2004 Information rights</TITLE> or This part of ISO 10303 specifies the application module Information rights. Richard's reply: The latter, i.e. in the BODY.

Changed so that the abstract does not say: "This part of ISO 10303" Instead: ISO/TS 10303-1248:2004 specifies the application module Product breakdown.
The following are within the scope of ISO/TS 10303-1248:2004:

issue.description:
Advised by email from Richard Cook ISO From: GOODWIN [goodwin@iso.org] Sent: Tue 09/11/2004 15:27 Subject: RE: AP239 modules
Il reste un seul probleme technique qu'ils ont oublie de corriger dans les fichiers de depart "iso10303_####.htm:
L'element <head> doit contenir un element <title>, comme exemple ci-dessous, autrement le validateur considere l'element <head> comme non fini <head> <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8"> <meta http-equiv="Refresh" content="0; URL=data/modules/information_rights/sys/cover.htm"> <title>ISO/TS 10303-1241:2004</title> </head>

comment.description: Corrected

issue.description: The abstract specifies "specifies the application module" there is a missing "for"

The expressions in the express should allow carriage returns.

comment.description: Corrected.

issue.description: Certain missing assertions are not caught by module error checking. These appear to be cases such as - select = select = entity, and perhaps cases of redeclared attributes that are selecgts. The AP mapping index catches these. It would be nice to catch them sooner.
Express_ref for enum value gives error ER-6.

comment.description: Modified common.xsl -a- template to display parens only if -a- tag contains additional text.

issue.description:
IN Annex E
Additional information, such as computer-interpretable rules derived from normative text or mappings in this part of ISO 10303, may be provided to support implementations. If the information is provided it can be found at the following URL:
Additional information: http://www.tc184-sc4.org/implementation_information/10303/00439
Can we pad the module number so that they appear in numeric order when somebody views the directory listing, e.g.:
http://www.tc184-sc4.org/implementation_information/10303/00439

comment.description: Modified

issue.description: The META data STEPMOD.mim.rcs.revision is outputting the date - not the revision.

comment.description: Corrected

issue.description:
META name="STEPMOD.module.rcs.date" content="Date: 2004/12/04 12:19:36 "
Use the ISO format for the date, e.g., "2004-12-04". See SC4 Resolution 457.

comment.description: Corrected - also for the AP XSL

issue.description: The descriptions for a subtype constraint mapping are in a table.

comment.description: Corrected

issue.description:
The mappings for a subtype constraint, may map to the supertype expression in an entity, rather than a supertype constraint. An example is in stepmod/data/modules/ap239_part_definition_information/module.xml
The DTD and XSL should be modified to support this.
The express-ref check is throwing a false error when checking for subtype.constraint

comment.description: Updated xsl:template name="check_express_ref" in common.xsl

issue.description: In stepmod/xsl/sect_isocover.xsl there is a parameter: SECRETARIAT It is assumed that this is set by the publication_index.xml through the ANT build. This is not the case, so I have defaulted the value to ANSI. This gets displayed on the ISO DIS cover page.

When display clause 5.2, the error Error IF-3a: The reference parameter for iso13584_expressions_schema is incorrectly specified. It should be of the form ISO 10303-***. will be thrown for reference=ISO 13584-

comment.description: Corrected - also for ISO 15926

issue.description:
We have made an assumption in the EXPRESS definitions in stepmod that that if you use a word with an _ in it then you are describing an EXPRESS entity, in which case it should be in bold or hyperlinked. We have implemented a test to enforce this.
However, it is not always the case that a word with an _ is an EXPRESS entity. It may be a string used in an attribute.
(Though someone once told me that there was an unwritten rule in SC4 that attribute strings should not contain _ . Maybe that just applied to strings added in mapping tables)
Anyway, an example is the application_protocol_definition_required rule that I believe that we are required to add to the AP MIM.

comment.description: To get around this, I have extended the dtd and xsl so that you tag such words with <tt>. This will be output in teletype or monospaced text style as below. I have also modified the test.

issue.description: publication/build.xsl is not creating dubplicate module dir information in publication_record.xml instead of adding info for files in sys and dvlp dirs.

comment.description: Fixed and also added xsl dirs.

issue.description: An inverse aggregate that does not have it upper and lower bounds declared is incorrectly displayed as: SET [:]

comment.description: Corrected.

issue.description: The MIM short names should be in alphabetical order.

comment.description: Corrected

issue.description: When a normative reference is made to an un published revision, The footnote in the normative references should say "To be published (Revision of ISO 10303-part:date)"
The normative references should be ordered ISO then IEC. I do not think that this affects any modules.
In clause 3 Terms and definitions, if there is an abbreviation for the term it should be provided on a new line after the term. Same applies for synomyms.

Update the meta data in the HTML to hold ALL the information that is in the SC4 cover page. I.e. add: DC.Replaces = the supercedes info. DC.Issued = publication date SC4.version = version
For check lists: SC4.checklist.internal_review = SC4 internal_review checklist SC4.checklist.project_leader = SC4 project_leader checklist SC4.checklist.convener = SC4 convener checklist

comment.description: Corrected

issue.description: The Dublin core elements are in Upper case - should be in lower case
The order of Figures and Tables are the wrong way around in the Table of contents

comment.description: Corrected

issue.description:
The URL in the foreword http://www.tc184-sc4.org/titles/STEP_Titles.htm.
is not that same format specified in the SD: <http://www.tc184-sc4.org/titles/STEP_Titles.htm>
The foreword was provided by ISO so we should change the approach used in the modules to conform with ISO.

comment.description: Changed everywhere
Changed for wg3 additional information URL

issue.description: The references to URLS should now say: "is available from the following URL: " Need to change the foreword. This was agreed between John McKillop ISO and Howard Mason SC4
